FuncDef: The display dhcp-access user-table command displays details about online DHCPv4 users.
CLIs: display dhcp-access user-table { all | index <user-index> | mac-address <mac-address> [ session-id <session-id> ] | user-id <user-id> } [ slave ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies details about all online DHCPv4 users.
-

Specifies the index of a specified user table.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1048575.

Displays details about a user with a specified MAC address.
The value is in the H-H-H format, of which H indicates a hexadecimal number of four characters, such as 00e0 and fc01. If less than four characters are entered, the remaining characters are 0s, for example, if e0 are entered, the value is 00e0.

Displays details about the user with a specified session ID.
The value is an integer starting from 1 to 4294967295.
If one-to-many mapping between one MAC address and many sessions is not enabled, the session ID of users is 0.

Specifies the ID of a user.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 3145727.

Displays details on the slave main control board.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The display dhcp-access user-table command is used to view details about online DHCPv4 users when you are monitoring DHCPv4 users or an error occurs in the DHCPv4 function.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
